meanings.definition: A substitute or replacement for something else.
meanings.sent1: When I ran out of milk, I used water as a succedanea in my coffee.
meanings.sent2: Paper napkins can be a succedanea for cloth napkins at a picnic.
meanings.sent3: The toy car served as a succedanea for the real car in the game of pretend.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was a succedanea for the missing music in the room.
meanings.sent5: The flashlight acted as a succedanea for the sun during the power outage.

meanings.definition: Something that takes the place of another.
meanings.sent1: His smartphone was a succedanea for a watch, as he used it to check the time.
meanings.sent2: The artificial sweetener is a succedanea for sugar in this recipe.
meanings.sent3: The plastic flowers were a succedanea for real flowers at the party.
meanings.sent4: The actor's understudy became a succedanea for him when he fell ill.
meanings.sent5: The digital map app is a succedanea for a paper map when traveling in the city.
